macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Global Stock Benchmarks Extend Rally to New Records
items.summary: The MSCI All Country World Index rose 0.2% to a fresh record, with Asian markets up 1.3% led by tech names like SoftBank. US and European equity futures are flat, while S&P 500 nears local highs amid tech rebound.

items.title: US Stocks Flirt with Records as S&P 500 Rises 0.1%, Dow Up 0.5%
items.summary: The S&P 500 gained 0.1% nearing its all-time high, Dow added 253 points or 0.5% to a record, and Nasdaq was flat amid mixed earnings. 10-year Treasury yield fell to 4.14% after weak consumer data boosts Fed rate cut hopes.

items.title: Asian Markets Rise Led by Japan Rally, US Equities Mixed
items.summary: Asian benchmarks mostly rose with strong gains in Japan post-election, while US stocks showed modest advances flirting with records. European indexes were mixed as traders await key US data like NFIB Optimism and ADP employment.

items.title: Mixed US Earnings: Hasbro Soars, Coca-Cola and S&P Global Slip
items.summary: Hasbro shares soared on strong profit reports, but Coca-Cola fell 1.4% after missing revenue expectations and weak guidance. S&P Global dropped 6.9% on disappointing profit forecast amid AI competition worries.

items.title: Traders Eye US Data for Fed Rate Path Clues
items.summary: Key releases including NFIB Small Business Optimism at 10:30 AM GMT and ADP employment change at 12:15 PM GMT could influence Fed rate cut expectations. Weak shopper data adds to hopes for cuts later this year.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Cadence Design Systems Launches Chipstack AI Agent for Chip Design
items.summary: Cadence Design Systems unveiled Chipstack, an AI agent that accelerates computer chip design by analyzing designs, building mental models, and autonomously fixing bugs. Companies like Nvidia are already adopting it, with predictions that virtual engineers could replace traditional roles by decade's end.

items.title: Researchers Develop ZKBoost: Privacy-Preserving Machine Learning Verification
items.summary: Researchers from CNRS and JPMorgan AI Research introduced ZKBoost, a zero-knowledge proof protocol that verifies XGBoost machine learning model training on sensitive data without exposing the data itself. The breakthrough enables trustworthy machine learning services while maintaining model accuracy within 1% of standard implementations.

items.title: Sanofi Reports AI-Driven Drug Discovery Breakthroughs in 2026
items.summary: Sanofi CEO Paul Hudson announced that AI has helped discover 10 completely new drug targets in one year, with AI agents now assessing whether drugs should advance trial phases. AI-powered patient recruitment tools have improved clinical trial enrollment rates by 65%, reducing recruitment timelines from months to days or weeks.

items.title: Thompson Reuters Acquires Noetica for AI-Powered Transaction Intelligence
items.summary: Thompson Reuters announced the acquisition of Noetica, an AI-native platform for corporate transaction intelligence, to strengthen its AI capabilities in business applications.

items.title: NIST Awards $3 Million to Small Businesses for AI and Quantum Technology
items.summary: The National Institute of Standards and Technology distributed over $3 million in grants to small businesses advancing AI, biotechnology, semiconductors, and quantum technologies, including projects for AI-powered cell culture monitoring and quantum photon sources.

items.title: AI Matures Into Core Business Function, Moving Beyond Pilot Phase
items.summary: According to MIT research, 70% of manufacturers plan to adopt AI technologies, with 71% expecting major transformation in quality control and defect detection. However, as many as 95% of AI pilots fail to deliver returns due to poor implementation and disconnection from core operations.

items.title: Texas Tech Develops AI-Enhanced Wearable Heart Monitoring Sensor
items.summary: Texas Tech researchers are developing a wearable real-time heart monitoring sensor using nanoparticles, artificial intelligence, and quantum phenomena. Machine learning models will analyze continuous data streams to provide 24-hour heart condition monitoring.

items.title: France-India AI Summit to Finalize International AI Governance Framework
items.summary: France's President Macron will attend the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi next month (February 19-20) to finalize international AI governance agreements balancing innovation and regulation, building on the 2025 Paris event.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: French Knighthoods Awarded to Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Developers
items.summary: Developers of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 received French knighthoods for their contributions to gaming. This recognition highlights industry achievements amid global updates.

items.title: Major Game Updates: Honkai Star Rail 4.0, Wuthering Waves 3.1 Released
items.summary: Honkai Star Rail 4.0 and Wuthering Waves 3.1 launched with significant updates, alongside NetEase's closed alpha for Sea of Remnants and Freestyle 2 Street Basketball's new character Yondu.

items.title: Upcoming Releases: High On Life 2, Ride 6, Yakuza Kiwami 3 Set for February 12-13
items.summary: New games launching February 11-13 include High On Life 2, Ride 6, Yakuza Kiwami 3, Dark Ties, and Rune Factory: Guardians of Azume across PC, consoles, and Switch 2.

items.title: Video Game Industry Faces Layoff Warnings Amid AI Advancements
items.summary: The gaming sector is warned of further layoffs due to AI tools like Google's Project Genie, which generates interactive game worlds from prompts, threatening developers at firms like Unity and Roblox.

items.title: Control Surpasses 5 Million Sales and 20 Million Players
items.summary: Remedy Entertainment reports Control has sold over 5 million copies and reached 20 million players, with plans to expand the franchise in 2026 despite a spin-off setback.

items.title: FZ: Formation Z Announces European Release for Summer 2026
items.summary: Japanese shooter FZ: Formation Z, a celebrated mecha game, is set to launch in Europe on PC and consoles starting June 9, 2026.

items.title: Gaming Monetization Shifts to Creator Economies Beyond Esports
items.summary: New income models for gamers in 2026 include merchandise, livestreaming, and digital products, expanding the US gaming economy valued at over 212 million players.

items.title: Steam PvP Fest Underway with Beta Tests for Neverness to Everness
items.summary: Steam's week-long PvP Fest is live, alongside limited betas for Neverness to Everness and GunZ The Duel, plus Roblox's reported 2025 growth.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
